Hi John, thanks for those comments, yes it's pretty rustic, LOL, good 
word that, it covers sooo much. My description should have said 2.3mm 
thick. Wow, 1.3 mm would be a very thin tsuba, more decorative that 
practical ????. I don't think there are any bones, I need to take better 
pics, when the sun returns I will attempt it. I am also curious about 
the wheel motif, if it is ?, all the wheel tsuba I have are either 
round, or a round wheel in another shape, but the wheel itself is always 
round. I wonder if this is something else I cannot see.

Rich

John Berta wrote:

> Hi Rich;
>
> Very interesting tsuba.  I do not think I have ever seen one like it.  
> Not the design or the unusually shaped large kozuka hitsu.  Sort of 
> like some of the early Jingo but different.
>
> The shape of the nakago ana is also unusual in that it does not have 
> the shape you would expect to see that would tightly fit a nakago, and 
> I think it would be difficult to fit a seppa without covering the 
> sukashi design.
>
> The look of the iron on the plate seems a little coarser and I do not 
> see any of the large bones in the surface of the plate.  Its hard to 
> tell from pictures though.  The hoan tsuba I have handled have been 
> abut 1.2 to 1.3mm thick.
>
> Very interesting unusual tsuba.
>
> John
